intro: Ornithogalum gussonei, commonly known as the mountain onion, is a bulbous plant native to southern Africa. It features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces clusters of white or pale green flowers during the summer months. The plant belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its underground bulb, which stores nutrients for growth. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is cultivated in some gardens.
